sentences.en: He pronounced a eulogy upon the hero.
He suggested vaguely that care must be taken in the eulogy of her friend.
sentences.cn: 他还隐晦地向她提议,在赞美她的朋友时一定要小心.

sentences.en: His descriptions of Gatsby's extravagant parties are closer to satire than eulogy.
sentences.cn: 他对盖茨比豪华宴会的描述与其说是称赞不如说是讽刺.

sentences.en: His former friend delivered the eulogy on his funeral.
sentences.cn: 追悼会上,他的生前好友致了悼辞.

sentences.en: I do not need to, you hypocritical eulogy.
sentences.cn: 我,也不需要, 你的虚伪悼词.

sentences.en: I will subscribe to any eulogy of him.
sentences.cn: 我愿把所有的赞词都奉献给他.

sentences.en: Indeed, no eulogy could be more grandiloquent than this.
It's sort of like the clothes you want the person giving a eulogy to wear.
sentences.cn: 这就像是你要给颂词人选参谋衣服一样.

sentences.en: Sir, such is my eulogy of the expedition to China.
sentences.cn: 先生, 这就是我对远征中国的赞赏.

sentences.en: The eulogy was the standard speech.
sentences.cn: 悼词采用标准的哀悼语言.

sentences.en: The minister delivered a long eulogy.
They chanted the eulogy of proletarian heroes.
sentences.cn: 他们歌颂无产阶级的英雄人物.

sentences.en: This eulogy poem well displays the author's praise for maternal love.
sentences.cn: 这首颂诗充分体现出了作者对母爱的赞颂之意.

sentences.en: This is a eulogy of the eminent naturalist.
sentences.cn: 这是篇颂扬这位杰出博物学家的致辞.

sentences.en: White poplar , the creature far from banality merits all my eulogy.
sentences.cn: 白杨树实在是不平凡的, 我赞美白杨树.

trans.tran_en: a speech or piece of writing in which you praise someone or something very much, especially at a funeral
